text: Phạm Huỳnh Tam Lang (14 February 1942 - 2 June 2014) was a Vietnamese football player and coach. He played for the teams Cho Lon Stars, Sai Gon Port and the South Vietnam national team in a twenty year career. He would later manage Sai Gon Port. Lang was born in Gò Công, French Indochina during World War II. Lang died from a stroke on 2 June 2014 in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, aged 75. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Asian footballers Category:Vietnamese people
title: Phạm Huỳnh Tam Lang
